Event.name: Change_of_leadership
Event.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns the appointment of a <fen>New_leader</fen> or removal from office of an <fen>Old_leader</fen>. The <fen>Selector</fen> brings about the change in leadership, for example, by electing or overthrowing a leader. Some words in the frame describe the successful removal from office of a leader (e.g. <ment>depose</ment>, <ment>oust</ment>), others simply the attempt (e.g. <ment>uprising, rebellion</ment>).
<ex>On March 17 , <fex name="Selector">Mamedov</fex> <t>appointed</t> <fex name="New_leader">Rakhim Gasiyev</fex> <fex name="Role">as Defence Minister</fex> .</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Selector
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The Selector (most commonly a group of people) is responsible for a change in leadership. Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.
<ex><fex name="Selector">The voters</fex> <t>elected</t> Blair.</ex> <ex><fex name="Selector">The president</fex> <t>appoints</t> the prime minister.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Old_leader
Arg.definition:
<def-root>With words denoting removal (or attempted removal) from office of a leader, the <fen>Old_leader</fen> is typically the direct object of verbs, or occurs in a PP Complement with noun targets, frequently headed by the preposition <ment>against</ment>.
<ex>The students <t>overthrew</t> <fex name="Old_leader">the president</fex>.</ex> <ex>The <t>uprising</t> <fex name="Old_leader">against the king</fex> was quickly ended by the military.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: New_leader
Arg.definition:
<def-root>With words denoting appointment to a position, the <fen>New_leader</fen> is typically the object of verbs.
<ex>The president <t>appoints</t> <fex name="New_leader">the prime minister</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Role
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Frequently the <fen>Old_leader</fen> or <fen>New_leader</fen> is referred to only by his/her role. However, the <fen>Role</fen> can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement.
<ex>The board of directors <t>appointed</t> Ashton <fex name="Role">Acting President</fex>.</ex> <ex>The board of directors <t>appointed</t> Ashton <fex name="Role">as Acting President</fex>.</ex> <ex>The voters <t>elected</t> Mitterand <fex name="Role">to the presidency</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Old_order
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Old_order</fen> identifies the political order that existed before the change of leadership occurs. <ex>The rebels <t>overthrew</t> <fex name="Old_order">the dictatorship</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Degree</fen> to which an event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Depictive</fen> indicates the state of one of the participants during the action.
<ex>We <t>dethroned</t> him, <fex name="Dep">unaware of the evil we did</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for the <fen>Manner</fen> of performing an action.
<ex>The king was <t>ousted</t> <fex name="Manr">violently</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Selector</fen> accomplishes the change of leadership. <ex>The rebels <t>overthrew</t> the government <fex name="Mns">by gaining the support of the military</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for indicating the <fen>Result</fen> of an event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This frame element describes the situation that brought about the change of leadership.
<ex>The king was <t>deposed</t> <fex name="Circumstances">in a bloody coup</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Function
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Function</fen> is the purpose the <fen>New_leader</fen> will fufill.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>When the change takes place. <ex>The <fex name="Time">2000</fex> <t>coup</t> against the dictator was led by former president Smith.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>Where the change takes place. <ex>The crew <t>mutinied</t> <fex name="Place">out in the middle of the Atlantic</fex>, the scoundrels.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Body
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function of governance.
<ex>His district <t>elected</t> her <fex name="bod">to Congress</fex> three times.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: coup.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a violent or illegal seizure of power

lexUnit.name: elect.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: choose (someone) to hold a position, especially public office, by voting.

lexUnit.name: insurrection.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a rising in open resistance to established authority

lexUnit.name: mutiny.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an open revolt against constituted authority, especially by soliders or sailors against their officers.

lexUnit.name: mutiny.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: revolt

lexUnit.name: overthrow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remove forcibly from power

lexUnit.name: rebellion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: n. open reisitance to authority, esp. organized armed resistance to an established government.

lexUnit.name: revolt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: rise in rebellion against authority

lexUnit.name: revolution.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the forcible overthrow of a government or social order, in favor of a new system.

lexUnit.name: uprising.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act of resistance or rebellion.

lexUnit.name: oust.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: drive out or expel, especially by forcing oneself into the place of

lexUnit.name: depose.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remove from office suddenly and forcefully

lexUnit.name: dethrone.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. remove (a monarch) from power.

lexUnit.name: overthrow.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a removal from power; a defeat or downfall.

lexUnit.name: revolt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an attempt to end the authority of a person or body by rebelling.

lexUnit.name: take over.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assume control of or responsibility for something.

lexUnit.name: topple.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to overthrow.

lexUnit.name: election.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal procedure whereby a person is elected, especially to a political office.

lexUnit.name: throne.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: install as leader (as if up on a throne).

lexUnit.name: enthrone.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: install (a monarch or bishop) on a throne with due ceremony.

lexUnit.name: coronate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: install as royal leader.

lexUnit.name: crown.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: ceremonially place a crown on the head of (someone) to invest them as a monarch.

lexUnit.name: vest.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: give new power to someone (or some group).

lexUnit.name: install.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: place as leader.

lexUnit.name: revolutionary.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who revolts or advocates revolution.

lexUnit.name: independence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: freedom from a former leader

lexUnit.name: rising.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a revolt against an authority

lexUnit.name: freedom.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A state with no overarching control or control defined fairly by those residing in said state.

lexUnit.name: ouster.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A situation in which a person holding some office is removed from that office abruptly. This term usually implies that regular proceedure is not followed, and some degree of force or coercion is used. Takes the FE Old_leader in a PP[of].
